main event: Two unidentified objects were observed moving in parallel at an altitude of approximately 1.5 miles over Chesterland, Ohio on June 8, 1959.
interesting points: The objects came from the horizon and appeared to be stationary for 3-5 minutes before moving off toward the horizon and disappearing downward.
Ground radar tracked an unidentified object at an altitude of approximately 30,000 feet about 15 miles south of Chesterland, Ohio on July 21, 1958.
The unidentified object was visually sighted by the pilots and navigator of a B-47 aircraft, but disappeared from radar before the aircraft could get close enough for a visual identification.
The unidentified object tracked on radar was described as being approximately 30 feet long and 20 feet wide, with a maximum range of 60-65 miles.
The report states that no special maneuvers were performed by the unidentified object, and it appeared to be approximately stationary.
sighted object: two unidentified objects moving in parallel, and an unidentified object tracked on radar
witnesses: B-47 aircraft crew, ground radar operators
photographs: yes, according to the record card
